title: Understanding Precedents
text: In spreadsheet software, a precedent is a cell that is referenced by a formula in another cell. This means that the value in the precedent cell is used in the calculation of the formula.

title: Identifying Precedents
text: If cell A1 contains the formula $$=B1+C1$$, which cells are the precedents?

title: Precedents in Formulas
text: A precedent is any cell that is directly referenced in a formula. This means that if a formula in cell D1 is $$=A1+B1$$, then A1 and B1 are precedents of D1.

hintAnswer: a cell referenced in the formula is a precedent of the cell containing the formula
title: Precedent Definition
text: What is a precedent in the context of spreadsheet formulas?
choices: a cell referenced in the formula is a precedent of the cell containing the formula
a cell that lies before another
a formula which is contained in a different formula
